prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular metal prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0523, 0.0. 2. Create the first face of this part by creating a new sketch on the XY plane. 3. Draw the following lines to construct a rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.314) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.314), End Point (0.0, 0.314) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.314), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The sketch should now consist of a single rectangular loop. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0523 units, creating the metal prism. Part 2: Construct a rectangular metal plate with two circular holes on opposite sides. 1. Create the first coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.061, 0.0, 0.0698 2. For the first face, create a sketch on the XY plane: 3. Draw two circles: - Circle 1: Center (0.0698, 0.0698), Radius 0.0698 - Circle 2: Center (0.5581, 0.0698), Radius 0.0698 These circles define the circular holes in the metal plate. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6279. 5. Extrude the sketch perpendicular to the XY plane by 0.0698 units, but along the opposite direction of the normal. This will create the metal plate with cutouts for the two holes. The final metal plate shape should be 0.6279 units long, 0.0698 units wide, and 0.6279 units high. The holes on opposite sides are 0.0698 units in radius.</description>
